availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Day S. Alsop (Scott County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Margaret Alsop. Resident of Scott County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Scott County in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from August 22, 1862, to August 21, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 487A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 959.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, Lytles Fork Precinct, p. 286B.
“Alsop, David,” Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0095.
"Day S Alsop (1837-1910)," Find A Grave, Memorial 118512007, accessed January 11, 2024, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/118512007.
KYR-0001-020-0502.
